# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load in 

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Input data files are available in the "../input/" directory.
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list the files in the input directory

import os
print(os.listdir("../input"))

df = pd.read_csv("../input/starbucks_drinkMenu_expanded.csv")

# Any results you write to the current directory are saved as output.
source.9e0665a4:
calories = df.Calories
sns.set_style("white")
plt.hist(calories)
plt.title("Calories histogram")
source.eccb0427:
sugar = df[" Sugars (g)"]
plt.hist(sugar)
plt.title("Sugar histogram")
source.b0192358:
x = calories
y = sugar
grid = sns.JointGrid(x, y, height=8, ratio=50)
grid.plot_joint(plt.scatter, color="g")
grid.plot_marginals(sns.rugplot, height=2, color="r")
source.88869a0a:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,8))
bar_cal = sns.barplot(x="Calories", y="Beverage_category", data=df)
plt.ylabel("")
source.2c04626b:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,4))
sizes = df[(df.Beverage_prep == 'Short') | (df.Beverage_prep == 'Venti') | (df.Beverage_prep == 'Grande') | (df.Beverage_prep == 'Tall')]
bar_sizes = sns.barplot(x="Calories", y="Beverage_prep", data=sizes)
plt.ylabel("")
source.4c3c6640:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,3))
milk = df[(df.Beverage_prep.str.contains('milk')) | (df.Beverage_prep.str.contains('Milk')) & ~((df.Beverage_prep.str.contains('Short')) | (df.Beverage_prep.str.contains('Grande')) | (df.Beverage_prep.str.contains('Venti')) | (df.Beverage_prep.str.contains('Tall')))]
bar_milk = sns.barplot(x="Calories", y="Beverage_prep", data=milk)
plt.ylabel("")
source.dd5d9dbb: From the histogram above, we know the distribution of sugars in Drinks of Starbucks. From the graph, a similarity to the histogram of calories is discovered.
source.67e1596a: From the bar chart above, we can gain a direct sense of which type of drink has relatively lower or higher level of calories.
source.76366108: From the histogram above, we know the distribution of calories in Drinks of Starbucks
source.b9d17e96: Now we generate a scatter plot of with x to be calories and y to be sugars.  We see that sugar and calories are nearly proportionally related.
source.d0b47fb9:
# Starbucks Drinks Calories EDA ### ECE 475 Project 1 ### Jing Jiang
This EDA shows the analysis of the calories in Starbucks drinks.
source.7c53fff5: From the bar chart above, we can see that larger size of the drink usually has larger calories.
source.4e7e3758: From the bar chart above, we can see that different milk options results in different calories.
